"We didn't make the correct switch," Sixers coach Maurice Cheeks said without singling out which player made the defensive mistake. Whoever didn't make the switch didn't do it on purpose. This isn't about placing blame, it's about figuring out how to do it right at the end. The next step is to reduce U.S. unemployment, an issue Barack Obama should make "the centerpiece" of his annual State of the Union address on Jan. 25, the former Cabinet member said. The American people are expecting him to say something about what he's going to do to keep the economy moving forward, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell has criticized his own party in recent months while supporting Barack Obama 's ultimately successful fight for Senate ratification of a new nuclear-arms-reduction treaty with Russia.
